question_text: Which of the following best explains why a CPU might remain idle even when memory bandwidth appears sufficient on paper?
answer_options: Memory modules are operating below rated voltage
RAM has reached its end-of-life threshold
The memory controller or channel is saturated, causing transfer delays
The operating system is prioritizing disk caching over RAM access
correct_answer: The memory controller or channel is saturated, causing transfer delays
explanation: Even with fast memory, bottlenecks in the controller or communication channels can prevent efficient data transfer, leaving the CPU waiting.
